sentences.sContent: Winning first place must have been quite a thrill.
sentences.sCn: 赢得第一名肯定让人非常激动。

sentences.sContent: Even though I’ve been acting for years, I still get a thrill out of going on stage.
sentences.sCn: 尽管我演了多年戏，走上舞台我仍然感到十分激动。

sentences.sContent: It gave Pat a thrill to finally see the group perform live.
sentences.sCn: 帕特终于看到这个乐队现场表演，感到十分激动。

synos.tran: 使…颤动；使…紧张；使…感到兴奋或激动
颤抖；感到兴奋；感到紧张

words.tran: 毛骨悚然的；令人兴奋的；颤动的
惊险小说；使人毛骨悚然的东西；使人毛骨悚然的小说

trans.tranOther: a sudden strong feeling of excitement and pleasure, or the thing that makes you feel this
